ERNAKULAM

Ernakulam is a district in the south-western part of Kerala that has a lot to offer for tourists. It is a place where you can enjoy the natural beauty, the historical heritage, and the cultural diversity of Kerala. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Ernakulam district that you can visit

Mattancherry Palace: This is a historically important palace built by the Portuguese in 1555, and later modified by the Dutch. It is also known as the Dutch Palace, and is famous for its mural paintings depicting scenes from Hindu epics. The palace also has a museum that displays various artifacts, weapons, and costumes related to the history and culture of Kochi

Bolgatty Palace: This is another historical palace and museum, built by the Dutch in 1744, and later used by the British. It is situated on the Bolgatty Island, and offers a splendid view of the backwaters and the city. The palace also has a heritage hotel, a golf course, a marina, and a garden

Hill Palace Museum: This is the largest archaeological museum in Kerala, and the former residence of the Cochin royal family. It is located on a hill, and has 49 buildings in the traditional Kerala style of architecture. The museum displays various items, such as paintings, sculptures, coins, jewellery, and furniture, belonging to the royal family and the Travancore Kingdom

Chinese Fishing Nets: These are unique and iconic fishing nets that line the shore of Fort Kochi. They are believed to have been introduced by the Chinese traders in the 14th century, and are still used by the local fishermen. The nets are operated by a system of ropes, poles, and weights, and can be lowered and raised by hand. The nets also offer a beautiful view of the sunset and the sea
